sn2.26:1.2: Standing to one side, the god Rohitassa said to the Buddha:
sn2.26:1.3: “Sir, is it possible to know or see or reach the end of the world by traveling to a place where there’s no being born, growing old, dying, passing away, or being reborn?”
sn2.26:1.4: “Reverend, I say it’s not possible to know or see or reach the end of the world by traveling to a place where there’s no being born, growing old, dying, passing away, or being reborn.”
sn2.26:2.2: how well said this was by Master Gotama.
sn2.26:3.1: Once upon a time, I was a hermit called Rohitassa, son of Bhoja. I was a sky-walker with psychic power.
sn2.26:3.2: I was as fast as a light arrow easily shot across the shadow of a palm tree by a well-trained expert archer with a strong bow.
sn2.26:3.3: My stride was such that it could span from the eastern ocean to the western ocean.
sn2.26:3.5: ‘I will reach the end of the world by traveling.’
sn2.26:3.6: Having such speed and stride, I traveled for my whole lifespan of a hundred years—pausing only to eat and drink, go to the toilet, and sleep to dispel weariness—and I passed away along the way, never reaching the end of the world.
sn2.26:4.2: how well said this was by Master Gotama:
sn2.26:4.3: ‘Reverend, I say it’s not possible to know or see or reach the end of the world by traveling to a place where there’s no being born, growing old, dying, passing away, or being reborn.’”
sn2.26:5.1: “But Reverend, I also say there’s no making an end of suffering without reaching the end of the world.
sn2.26:5.2: For it is in this fathom-long carcass with its perception and mind that I describe the world, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation.
sn2.26:6.1: The end of the world can never
sn2.26:6.3: But without reaching the end of the world,
sn2.26:7.1: So a clever person, understanding the world,
sn2.26:7.2: has completed the spiritual journey, and gone to the end of the world.
sn2.26:7.3: A peaceful one, knowing the end of the world,
sn2.26:7.4: does not hope for this world or the next.”
